item.description:
Would anyone like to do a guided canoe tour of the marsh at the Connecticut Audubon center at Milford Point? Your host, Vanessa, is a volunteer there and went a couple of times last year. It's fun and would be great for a group. Fresh air, a bit of exercise, socializing, and nice scenery and birds. The guides tell you all about the marsh and wildlife, and help you learn how to canoe if you don't know already.

The canoe tour goes through the Charles Wheeler Salt Marsh at Milford Point. The trip offers the chance to see abundant wildlife, including this season's four Osprey chicks. The chicks have already begun flying in preparation to leave the nest this fall. 

 Canoeists enjoy beautiful vistas of the marsh, learn the basics of canoeing from an experienced instructor, and hear all about the fascinating history of the area, from Native American times to today. 

 Advance registration is required, so if you want to join in, you need to call the CT Audubon Society Coastal Center at Milford Point to make a booking: 203-878-7440.    Bring water, and wear shoes that can you don't mind getting wet.

Prices:

Coastal Center Canoes
CAS Members $25/person, $65/canoe (3 people)
Non-members $35/person, $95/canoe (3 people)

Private Canoe/Kayak
$19 CAS Members, $29 Non-members


Please put in your comments whether or not you've actually registered.
item.name: Canoe trip!
